task.title: Customize to Render CGM Images (Experimental Support)

keywords.indexterm: XML documentsAuthor Mode editingImage renderingCGM images
CGM image rendering in Author mode

prereq.p: To render CGM images in Author mode, requires the use of an ISOView Active X component for Internet Explorer, so this component must be installed even if you do not use Internet Explorer. If you have used PTC products, you may already have the PTC IsoView ActiveX component installed.This support will only work on 32 bit versions of .

context.p: provides experimental support for CGM 1.0 images. To allow the rendering of CGM images in Author mode, follow this procedure:

step.cmd: Go to Help Install new add-ons to open an add-on selection dialog box.
Select the default update site from the drop-down menu (http://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Addons/default/updateSite.xml).
Select CGM Form Control plugin and click Next.
Select the I accept all terms of the end user license agreement option and click Finish.

For frameworks other than DITA, DocBook, or XHTML, modify your CSS according to your particular framework. The CGM Form Control plugin recognizes CGM files in DITA, DocBook, and XHTML, so for those frameworks, this step is not necessary.
